title: Is utilitarianism too demanding and strict? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. That is one of its problems. This is especially so with straightforward act utilitarianism, though one might dress up rule utilitarianism to try to weaken the problem. Specifically, one of the premises of utilitarianism is that you are not special. Your loved ones are not special. All human beings — or perhaps all creatures capable of feeling pleasures and pains — are entitled to the same consideration as is you first-born child. Every act should be judged by how it affects the global balance of pleasures versus pains. Think about how that might work, and what it would do to all normal human relationships if there were any serious effort to make it work. It is pretty dystopian, as some of Bentham’s ideas (in prison design, for example) exemplify.
